perturbation.original_text: Emdeon Corporation a Delaware corporation (“Emdeon”), with offices at at 669 River Drive, Center 2, Elmwood Park, New Jersey 07407 and WebMD, Inc. a Georgia Corporation (“WebMD”), with offices at 111 Eighth Avenue, New York, NY 10011. Emdeon and WebMD expressly agree that this Agreement incorporates the Terms and Conditions attached hereto.
perturbation.changed_text: Healthcare Solutions Inc., a Delaware corporation (“Emdeon”), with offices at at 669 River Drive, Center 2, Elmwood Park, New Jersey 07407 and WebMD, a service of Internet Brands (“WebMD”), with offices at 111 Eighth Avenue, New York, NY 10011. Emdeon and WebMD expressly agree that this Agreement incorporates the Terms and Conditions attached hereto.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the full legal name and type of business creates confusion as to whether the same entities are bound by this agreement. 'Emdeon Corporation' is changed to 'Healthcare Solutions Inc.', and 'WebMD, Inc. a Georgia Corporation' is changed to 'WebMD, a service of Internet Brands' causing uncertainty regarding which entities are legally responsible for fulfilling the contract terms.

perturbation.original_text:
Fees for the Content shall be $5,000 per year.
Additional anatomical line drawings shall be licensed to Emdeon at an incremental charge of $150 per drawing.
perturbation.changed_text:
Fees for the Information shall be $5,000 per year.
Additional anatomical line drawings may be licensed to the Licensee at an incremental charge of $200 per drawing.
perturbation.explanation: Here, 'Content' is now referred to as 'Information', it's unclear whether they are identical. Furthermore, 'Emdeon' is referred to as the 'Licensee'. It's unclear whether the 'Licensee' refers to 'Emdeon' (or 'Healthcare Solutions Inc.') from the first paragraph. The incremental charge is also changed, causing uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: All material notices and other communications required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and notices will be deemed given three (3) days after they are sent by first class mail, return receipt requested, and one (1) day after they are sent by overnight courier or upon receipt if delivered by hand delivery, to the receiving party’s address as set forth in the first paragraph above, or to such other address that the receiving party may have provided in writing to the other party for purposes of receiving notices as provided in this Section.
perturbation.changed_text: All formal notifications and other correspondence required or allowed under this Agreement will be in written format. Communications are considered served five (5) business days after being mailed via certified postal service, return confirmation requested, or instantaneously if delivered electronically, to the addresses of the respective entities as initially stated, unless a different address has been formally communicated for notification purposes.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'material notices' is now 'formal notifications', 'communications' is now 'correspondence'. 'First class mail, return receipt requested' is now 'certified postal service, return confirmation requested'. The timings have also changed: 'three (3) days' becomes 'five (5) business days', 'one (1) day' becomes 'instantaneously'. The language 'receiving party' is now 'respective entities'. These changes introduce ambiguity regarding the exact methods and timing for delivering and acknowledging notices, potentially leading to disputes over whether proper notice was given.
